org.ranksys.compression.preferences

Class AbstractCODECPreferenceData<U,I,Cu,Ci>

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.uam.eps.ir.ranksys.fast.preference.AbstractFastPreferenceData<U,I>
      • org.ranksys.compression.preferences.AbstractCODECPreferenceData<U,I,Cu,Ci>
  • Type Parameters:
    U - type of users
    I - type of items
    Cu - coding for user identifiers
    Ci - coding for item identifiers
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ItemIndex<I>, UserIndex<U>, PreferenceData<U,I>, FastItemIndex<I>, FastUserIndex<U>, FastPreferenceData<U,I>, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryCODECPreferenceData, RatingCODECPreferenceData

    public abstract class AbstractCODECPreferenceData<U,I,Cu,Ci>
extends AbstractFastPreferenceData<U,I>
implements FastPreferenceData<U,I>
    Abstract PreferenceData using compression.
    If you use this code, please cite the following papers:
    • Vargas, S., Macdonald, C., Ounis, I. (2015). Analysing Compression Techniques for In-Memory Collaborative Filtering. In Poster Proceedings of the 9th ACM Conference on Recommender Systems. http://ceur-ws.org/Vol-1441/recsys2015_poster2.pdf.
    • Catena, M., Macdonald, C., Ounis, I. (2014). On Inverted Index Compression for Search Engine Efficiency. In ECIR (pp. 359–371). doi:10.1007/978-3-319-06028-6_30
    The code that reproduces the results of the RecSys 2015 poster by Vargas et al. in a separated project: http://github.com/saulvargas/recsys2015
    The search index compression technologies of the ECIR paper by Catena et al. is part of the Terrier IR Platform: http://terrier.org/docs/v4.0/compression.html.
    Author:
    Saúl Vargas (Saul.Vargas@glasgow.ac.uk)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
